item.title: Introduction
item.description: I made this project because I wanted to monitor a website changes. It helped me a lot and by, so I wanted to share my code with others. How it works? Currently, web-watcher only support HTML pages, it analyzes the page structure and tags and defines a ratio which determines if page has changed or not. By so, text changes are not detected, only page structure changes trigger changes. Example

item.title: Install
item.description: You can install the pre-compiled binary (in several different ways), use Docker or compile from source. Here are the steps for each of them: Install the pre-compiled binary Download the pre-compiled binaries from the [releases page][https://github.com/shellbear/web-watcher/releases] and copy to the desired location. Running with Docker You can also run it within a Docker container. Here as follows an example command: docker run -d -e DISCORD_TOKEN -v web-watcher-data:/app docker.pkg.github.com/shellbear/web-watcher/web-watcher By default, Go v1.
